snippet: The Manhattan branch of a popular chain from Delhi wins two stars from Pete Wells.
abstract: The Manhattan branch of a popular chain from Delhi wins two stars from Pete Wells.
lead_paragraph: “Foods that give us a deep feeling of indulgence aren’t always the ones you’d expect,” Pete Wells wrote in The New York Times, “meanwhile, at a quiet Indian restaurant in the East 60s called Moti Mahal Delux, a bowl of lentils can make you go wobbly with happiness.”

headline.main: Restaurant Review: Moti Mahal Delux in Manhattan
